column2: Hey, you guys! Guess what? Barry and Mindy are getting a divorce!'
Oh my God!'
Wow!'
(To Ross) What is the matter with you?!'
No! Barry and Mindy.'
Oh sorry, I hear divorce I immediately go to Ross. (To Rachel)\nWho-who\xc2\x92s Barry and Mindy?'
Barry was the guy that I was almost married and Mindy was my best\nfriend.'
Ohh-oh, wasn\xc2\x92t he cheating on you with her?'
Yeah, but that just means that he was falling asleep on top of her\ninstead of me.'
Why did they get divorced?'
Well, apparently she caught him cheating on her with someone else.\nIsn\xc2\x92t that sad? (Giggles.) God, could you imagine if I actually married him?! I mean\nhow different would my life be?'
I know what you mean, I\xc2\x92ve always wondered how different my life\nwould be if-if I\xc2\x92d never gotten divorced.'
Which time?'
The first time! No seriously, imagine if Carol hadn\xc2\x92t realized she\nwas a lesbian.'
(starts to imagine it) I can\xc2\x92t. I keep seeing it the good way.'

I\xc2\x92d bet I\xc2\x92d still be doing my kara-tay. (That\xc2\x92s karate,
he\xc2\x92s just saying it that way.) Towards the end of our marriage I was doing a lot of
kara-tay as a way of releasing the tension from y\xc2\x92know, not doing anything else
physical.'
Maybe the problem was you were pronouncing it kara-tay.'
And what if I was still fat? (To Chandler) Well, you wouldn\xc2\x92t be\ndating me, that\xc2\x92s for sure.'
Sure I would!'
(simultaneously) Oh yeah! Come on! Yeah right!'
What, you guys really think that I\xc2\x92m that shallow?'
No, I just think Monica was that fat.'
Hey, imagine if I never got fired off Days Of Our Lives! (Closes\nhis eyes to do so.) Oh-hey, there\xc2\x92s Carol again!'

What if I had had the guts to quit my job? I\xc2\x92d probably be\nwriting for the New Yorker, getting paid to be funny. But my job\xc2\x92s fun too! I\nmean tomorrow, I-I don\xc2\x92t have to wear a tie.'
What if I had taken that job at Merrill Lynch?'
What?!'
Merrill Lynch?'
Yeah, I had a massage client who worked there and-and he said I had a\nknack for stocks.'
Well why didn\xc2\x92t you take the job?'

Because at that time you see, I thought everything that rhymed was true.\nSo I thought y\xc2\x92know that if I\xc2\x92d work with stocks, I\xc2\x92d have to live in a\nbox, and only eat lox, and have a pet fox.'
Hey, do you guys think that if all those things happened, we\xc2\x92d still\nhang out?'

This is where the opening credits are, but they\xc2\x92re not
the usual opening credits. Oh no! These credits are based on the world that would
have been created had all of the above actually happened. It starts out with all of them
at the fountain sitting on the couch as Fat Monica runs up and sits on the arm of the
couch, tilting the whole thing towards her. It then goes on to show Rachel\xc2\x92s still a
shop-aholic and with Barry. Fat Monica is sweating while cooking and dancing while eating
a donut. Phoebe as the Wall Street shark smoking while on two cell phones. Then
they\xc2\x92re dancing in the fountain. Joey entering as Dr. Drake Remoray and meeting a
groupie. Chandler trying to write as a bird does its business on his shoulder and falling
asleep while typing. Ross doing some kara-tay and trying to get Carol into bed. And
finally, some more dancing in the fountain, them all flexing, and the turning out the lamp
and shutting off all the lights bit from the first season. Just remember one thing, this
is an alternate universe. Everything from every other episode doesn\xc2\x92t apply, for
instance, Ross and Rachel have no history. And in fact have not seen each other in years
in this world.}'
(recognizing her) Oh my God! Rachel Green?'
(gasps) Rob Tillman!'
No-no. It\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s me, Ross!'
Oh, I\xc2\x92m sorry. Ross Tillman.'
No, no-no, Ross Geller.'
Ohh, of course Monica\xc2\x92s brother!'
Yeah. Right.'
Wow! How are you?!'
Good-good, I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m married. (Shows her his ring.)'
Ohh! Me too!'
Is-isn\xc2\x92t it the best?'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s the best! (They both exhale contemplating the joys of\nmarriage.) So, umm how\xc2\x92s Monica?'
Oh really, really great! Yeah! A-actually she\xc2\x92s right down the\nstreet, umm, do-do you know what? You should stop bye and say hi.'
Ohh, I would love too.'
Yeah? Oh-oh, she\xc2\x92d be so excited!'
Ohh! Okay!'
Come on! (They start to leave.)'
Oh wait, don\xc2\x92t you have to pay for your, (looks at his magazine)\nBusty Ladies?'
No, it\xc2\x92s okay. Some-some kid asked me to pick it up for him, but I\ndon\xc2\x92t\xc2\x85'
(laughs) Oh yeah? Okay.'
(putting the magazine back and holding the money for it) Okay.'
But! Don\xc2\x92t you have to give him his money back?'
Uh-huh. (Steps to a random kid nearby and hands him his money.) Hey, here\nyou go buddy. Sorry, no porn for you. (To Rachel) Okay, let\xc2\x92s go see Monica!'
So Monica, still going out with Dr. Boring huh?'
He\xc2\x92s not boring! He\xc2\x92s just-he\xc2\x92s just low key.'
(returning) Here we go, one Hazelnut Latte. (Hands it to\nMonica and sits down.)"
Thanks.'
Yeah. Y\xc2\x92know, the hazelnut actually not a nut,\nit\xc2\x92s a seed."
(not impressed) Wow!!'
Can anyone else name a well known seed that\xc2\x92s been\nmasquerading as a nut?"
Oh dear God, let me think. (Starts to sarcastically think about it.)'
(entering, depressed) Hey.'
Hey.'
Oh no! What\xc2\x92s the matter?'
Oh I just got another rejection letter. They said my writing was\nfunny, just not "Archie Comic funny."'
Y\xc2\x92know what honey? I got to get back to the hospital."
Okay.'
(kisses her) Okay."
Bye.'
Bye-bye. (Gets up to leave.) Oh uh, by the way, the answer\nis, the Brazil nut. (Exits.)"
Was his question what\xc2\x92s more boring than him?'
Hey man, look sorry about that Archie thing. Do uh, do you need me\nto give you some money?'
Hey, I may have no money, but I still have my pride.'
Really?'
Ehh.'
Maybe Joey doesn\xc2\x92t have to give you the money, TV stars have\nassistants right?'
That\xc2\x92s an idea! (To Chandler) Hey, if I hired an assistant,\nwould-would you take money from her?'
No Joey! Chandler could be your assistant! See, he could answer all of\nyour fan mail and stuff!'
That\xc2\x92s great! That would be great! Let\xc2\x92s do that!'
I could use the money; it could give me time to write.'
Oh right great! Welcome aboard!'
Okay!'
All right! Now hey, I need to use the bathroom. Since I don\xc2\x92t need\nany assistance in there, take a break!'
All right!'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey Phoebe! Guess what?'
What?'
Joey just hired Chandler to be his assistant!'

Ohh that\xc2\x92s so sweet! (Her cell phone rings.) Oh! Hang on! (Quickly
grabs a cigarette and starts to light it as her phone rings.) Hang onnnnnn!!! (Gets the
cigarette lighted and answers the phone.) (On phone.) Go!! No! No-no! I said sell when it
hits 50! 5-0, it\xc2\x92s a number! It comes after 4-9!! No, it\xc2\x92s okay. It\xc2\x92s okay,
you\xc2\x92re allowed one mistake. Just kidding, you are of course fired.'
Hey Mon! '
Hey!'
Mon, look who I ran into! (Gestures towards Rachel.)'

(gets up and gasps) Oh my God! Rachel!! (Rachel is stunned to see that\nher long lost friend is still fat.) (Monica goes over and gives Rachel a big bear hug,\nwhich is quite easy for her.) You look terrific!'
Ohh, so do you! Did you lose weight? (She\xc2\x92s not quite sure of that\none.)'
You are so sweet to notice! Yes, I lost three and a half pounds!'
And, and uh, you-you remember my friend Chandler. (Points to him.)'
Hey.'
Oh yeah.'
And that\xc2\x92s Phoebe over there! (Points to her.)'
Hi!'
Oh my God, sit down! Sit down! How long as it been since we\xc2\x92ve seen\neach other?'
(answering it) 1987, the day after Christmas, at Sean McMahon\xc2\x92s\nparty. I played you one of my songs, y\xc2\x92know Interplanetary Courtship Ritual.'
Oh yeah. Right. So now, are\xc2\x97do you, do you still do music?'
Sometimes, you should come over (Joey returns from the bathroom) sometime!\nI\xc2\x92ll play you one of my other\xc2\x85'
(interrupting him and seeing Joey) Oh my God! Joey Tribbiani from Days\nof Our Lives, just walked in here!'
Rach, he\xc2\x92s a friend of ours.'
(stunned) You are friends with Dr. Drake Remoray?'
Well it\xc2\x92s kinda hard to be friends with Drake because of his busy\nschedule and the fact that he\xc2\x92s not real.'
(To Rachel) Hey-hey, or I could bring my keyboard over here\nsometime!'
He\xc2\x92s coming over! He\xc2\x92s coming over!'
(getting up) Joey!'
(holding a plate of what looks like Rice Crispies Treats) I know,\nhere-here!! (Hands her the plate.)'
Ohhh! (Takes the plate.) No! This is my friend Rachel, we went to High\nSchool together.'
(giggles and can\xc2\x92t look at him) Hi!'
(shaking Rachel\xc2\x92s hand) Hi!'
(still not quite able to look at him) Hi! I love you on that show! I\nwatch you everyday! I mean, when you took out your own kidney to save your ex-wife even\nthough she tired to kill you\xc2\x85'
Well, it\xc2\x92s always nice to meet the fans.'
Ah!'
(turning and whispering to Monica) She\xc2\x92s not crazy is she?'
No.'
(To Rachel) So uh, how you doin\xc2\x92?'

Hang on! Hang on! Hang on! (Answering the phone.) Go!! Who\xc2\x92s this?
(Listens) Oh okay, you\xc2\x92re gonna like working for me. What\xc2\x92s your name? (Listens)
What kind of name is Brendy? I\xc2\x85 Whatever\xc2\x85 Stop talking! All right, from now on
your name is Joan. You can pick your own last name.'
(entering) Hey there you are!'
Uh-oh, it\xc2\x92s my boss!'

All right, here\xc2\x92s a list of things for you to do today. Man, this\ngoing to be so great! Thank you so much! All right, I got to go to work I\xc2\x92m\ndelivering twins today, but only one of them is mine! (Exits.)'
(reading the list) Drop off my dry cleaning. Pick up my vitamins.\nTeach me how to spell vitamins. Wear in my new jeans.'
(laughs) You realize what you are don\xc2\x92t you?'
What?'
You\xc2\x92re his bitch.'
(yelling from Monica\xc2\x92s room) No-no!! No!!'
(panicked) Oh wait! You didn\xc2\x92t just sit on my Kit-Kats did\nyou?!!'
No! There-there was a little, a little diff in the market and I lost 13\nmillion dollars.'
But the Kit-Kats are all right?!'
What am I gonna do?! What am I gonna do?! I can\xc2\x92t call my office\nthey\xc2\x92ll kill me! I can\xc2\x92t call my clients they\xc2\x92ll kill themselves! Great,\nnow my chest hearts.'
What?!'
(louder) My chest hurts! Oh, and now I-I can\xc2\x92t breathe.'
Phoebe, are you having a heart attack?! '
Oh, if I were, would-would I have shooting pains up and down my left\narm?'
Yes!!'
Then yes that is what I\xc2\x92m having. (Takes another puff of the\ncigarette.)'
Oh my God!'
Come on Pheebs, it\xc2\x92s not that bad! Y\xc2\x92know most people would be\nexcited if they didn\xc2\x92t have to work for a couple of weeks.'
Most people don\xc2\x92t like their jobs, I love my job! I have not\nbeen working for three hours and I\xc2\x92m already going crazy. I miss Joan.'
Honey, having a heart attack is nature\xc2\x92s way of telling you to slow\nit down.'

I always thought having a heart attack was nature\xc2\x92s way of\ntelling you to die! (Phoebe glares at him.) But you\xc2\x92re not gonna die. I mean, you are\ngoing to die, but you\xc2\x92re not gonna die today. I wish I was dead.'
Let\xc2\x92s take a walk. (They start to leave.) Y\xc2\x92know maybe you\nshould consider writing for Talking Out of Your Ass magazine! (They exit.)'
(To Ross) So what\xc2\x92s going on with you?'
Well umm, I\xc2\x92ve been doing a lot more of my kara-tay.'
Still going through that dry spell with Carol?'
Yeah.'
How long has it been since you had sex?'
Well, last weekend\xc2\x85'
Oh that\xc2\x92s not so bad.'
\xc2\x85will be two months\xc2\x85'
That is.'
\xc2\x85since I stopped trying.'
Maybe you need to spice things up a little.'
What-what do you mean?'
I don\xc2\x92t know. You could tie her up, she could tie you up; you could\neat stuff off each other\xc2\x85'
Oh.'
Y\xc2\x92know, dirty talk, m\xc3\xa9nage \xc3\xa0 trois, toys\xc2\x85'
Wow!'
Roll playing\xc2\x85 You could be the warden; she could be the prisoner.\nYou could be the pirate; she could be the wench!'
Okay, I think I got it.'

Yeah! Or too, you could be two stockbrokers and\nyou\xc2\x92re-you\xc2\x92re-you\xc2\x92re rolling around naked on the trading floor and\neverybody\xc2\x92s watching! (Ross looks at her.) It never happened.'
Sorry. So how\xc2\x92s it going with Joey?'
Oh just great. He beeps me now with codes. One is, "Bring me\nfood." Two is, "I\xc2\x92m with a girl, bring us food." Three is,\n"I\xc2\x92m lost and I can\xc2\x92t find food."'
(entering) Hey! Is uh, is she gonna be all right?'
Yeah! She\xc2\x92s right in there! (Points to Phoebe\xc2\x92s room.)'
Oh great. (Starts to go in.) (To Chandler) Hey! Go take off those pants,\nthey look ready!'
All right, and over there is Brady\xc2\x92s Pub where I like to unwind after\na long day of surgeoning.'
Wow! This is so amazing! What else? What else?'
Well, that is a large piece of television equipment. (Points at a\nlarge piece of television equipment as an old man walks by.) And uh that is an old\nman! Hey old man!'
Hey!'
All righty, what do you say we head back to my place?'
(laughs) Wow! Umm, y\xc2\x92know, I-I would really love to, but I-I\nshouldn\xc2\x92t.'
Why? (In Drake\xc2\x92s voice.) Why can\xc2\x92t the world stop turning, just\nfor a moment? Just for us?'
(awestruck, then not) Isn\xc2\x92t that a line from the show?!'
Uh, yeah but uh, (In Drake\xc2\x92s voice) I may have said those things\nbefore but, I never truly meant them. Until now.'
That\xc2\x92s a line from the show too!'
Okay, you watch too much TV.'
(approaching) Here you go Joe, here\xc2\x92s the freshly squeezed orange\njuice you asked for. (Hands it to him.)'
Thanks! (Looks at it.) Yeah, there\xc2\x92s pulp in that. (Hands it back.)'
Yeah?'
I thought we talked about this. I don\xc2\x92t like pulp. No pulp. Pulp\nisn\xc2\x92t juice. All juice, okay?'
I\xc2\x92m sorry, I guess I just like the pulp.'
Oh my God, I\xc2\x92m sorry, I\xc2\x92m being so rude. (Turns to Rachel.)\nRachel, would like a soda or something? Because Chandler would run right out and get it.'
Yeah sure, iced tea would be great.'
(To Chandler) Iced tea.'
Okay, anything for you sir?'
(To Rachel) Did I not just tell him?'
(mouthing it to him) Yes, you did.'

(To Chandler) Okay look, Chandler, if this (Motions back and forth\nindicating the arrangement.) you have got to listen! (Tugs on his ear.) (Chandler glares\nat him.) You\xc2\x92re gonna throw that juice at me, aren\xc2\x92t ya?'
It\xc2\x92s not all juice! (Rachel quickly gets out of the way.)'
So honey, this morning was fun, huh? Me hopping in on you in the shower\nthere.'
Yeah! And maybe someday we could get a place with two bathrooms.'
Look Carol umm, I was, I was thinking maybe uh, maybe we can spice things\nup a little.'
What do you mean?'
Carol our sex life is\xc2\x97it\xc2\x92s just not working\xc2\x85'
(entering) Dad!! (Runs and hugs him.)'
Hey there little fella! Hey, uh-hey, why don\xc2\x92t we get some shoes on\nya, huh? Hey, why don\xc2\x92t you show dad how you can put your shoes on, in your room!\nYay!!'
Yay! (Runs off.)'
Yay! (To Carol) Seriously, our sex life\xc2\x85 I was thinking, maybe I\ndon\xc2\x92t know, we could try some-some new things. Y\xc2\x92know? For fun?'
Like what?'

Well I don\xc2\x92t know umm, (Pause) what if we were too tie each other up?
(Carol\xc2\x92s shocked and obviously doesn\xc2\x92t like that idea.) Umm, some people eat
stuff off one another. (Carol doesn\xc2\x92t like that idea either.) Nah! Umm, y\xc2\x92know
we-we could try dirty talk? (Carol still says no.) Umm, we could, we could have a
threesome.'
(quickly) I love that idea!'
Who sold a story to Archie Comics?!'
Oh my God! That\xc2\x92s great! Oh wow! (Hugs him.) You\xc2\x92re a\npublished writer! I wish I had a present for you!'
Aww.'
Wait a minute! (Quickly checks her pockets and pulls out\xc2\x85) My last Kit-Kat\nbar!'
You wanna share it?'
Okay!!'

(entering) Hey! Hey Chandler look, I know you\xc2\x92re mad, but I just want\nto say I\xc2\x92m sorry. I-I was a total jerk. Completely o-over the line. Uh, I just I hate\npulp! Y\xc2\x92know? I mean, y\xc2\x92know how Monica feels about low fat mayonnaise?'
It\xc2\x92s not mayonnaise!!'
Yeah, o-o-o-o-okay anyway, I just wanted to say I\xc2\x92m sorry. Here.\n(Hands him a cup.) '
What\xc2\x92s this?'
Fresh squeezed orange juice, with pulp! Just the way you like it.'
Aww, thanks man. (They hug.)'
Hey Joey, Chandler sold a story to Archie Comics!'
Oh my God! That\xc2\x92s great! Congratulations! What\xc2\x92s the story?!'
Oh you wouldn\xc2\x92t uh, care. It\xc2\x92s just a stupid comic book\nstory.'
Are you kidding me?! I love Archie! And the whole gang!'

Well uh, Archie needs money to fix his jalopy (Joey laughs), uh but he
doesn\xc2\x92t want Reggie to just give him the money. So Reggie hires him as his
assist\xc2\x97as his butler. And then makes him do all these crazy things like bring him
milkshakes that can\xc2\x92t have lumps in them.'
Wait a minute. That sounds a little familiar! Did they already do that\none? \xc2\x91Cause I think I read it!'
Oh Mon, listen I have to ask! Okay, Joey Tribbiani invited me back to\nhis apartment, now does he do this with a lot of girls?'
Yeah, a lot. A lot, a lot!'
Ohh! And I\xc2\x92m one of them!! Wow! Oh, I just cannot believe this! I\nmean, Joey Tribbiani!'
Well, y\xc2\x92know it\xc2\x92s none of my business, but aren\xc2\x92t you\nmarried?'
Yeah. Oh I just wish we could not be married for a little bit!\nY\xc2\x92know I just wish we could be like on a break!'
Well, you\xc2\x92re not.'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s so easy for you I mean, you\xc2\x92re not married, you get\nto have sex with who ever you want!'
Yeah I can! (Laughs) And don\xc2\x92t think I don\xc2\x92t, because I do! I\nmean all the time, you betcha! (Laughs.)'
Monica. You\xc2\x92ve, you\xc2\x92ve done it right?'
(giggles) Of course I have! What do you think, I\xc2\x92m some 30 year old\nvirgin?'
Oh my God! You\xc2\x92re a 30 year old virgin!'
Say it louder, I don\xc2\x92t think the guy all the way in the back heard\nyou!'

It\xc2\x92s not like, I haven\xc2\x92t any opportunities. I mean,
y\xc2\x92know, I\xc2\x92m just waiting for the perfect guy. I\xc2\x92m seeing this guy Roger,
all right? He\xc2\x92s not perfect, but umm, I think maybe I should just get it over with.
Y\xc2\x92know, give him my flower.'
Oh my God!! Do it!! Honey, you\xc2\x92ve waited long enough!!'
Y\xc2\x92know what? You are right?!'
Yes!! I mean sex does not have to be a big deal! There shouldn\xc2\x92t be\nall this rules and restrictions! Y\xc2\x92know, people should be able to sleep with who ever\nthey want, whenever\xc2\x85'
Rachel! I\xc2\x92m never gonna think it\xc2\x92s okay for you to cheat on\nyour husband!'
Oh what do you know? Virgin!'
Phoebe, why is smoke coming out of the bathroom?!'
Oh yeah, the doctor said that could be one of the side effects. '
Phoebe! Put that cigarette out!'
No! It\xc2\x92s not a cigarette! The smoke is coming out of me!'
Put it out!!'
Okay! Okay! (Puts it out and comes out of the bathroom.) I\xc2\x92m so\nglad you\xc2\x92re here.'
Come on. (Helps her into bed as her phone rings.) I got it.'
Oh, give it to me.'
I got it!'
Give it!'
(on the phone) Hello? (Listens.) No she can\xc2\x92t come to the phone right\nnow. (Listens.) Oh, right no problem. Okay, bye-bye. (Hangs up.)'
Was it my work? Were they mad? Was it Jack? Did he yell?!'
J-j-just relax, nobody yelled. Jack just was calling to make sure that you\nwere getting better.'
Thank God.'
(To Monica) Yeah, she\xc2\x92s fired.'
You\xc2\x92ve done all you can Dr. Wesley. You have got to let\nher go.'
Good-bye and God speed, Hope Brady. '
Not so fast Wesley! (Rachel does a silent clap.)'
(with evil dripping off his tongue) Remoray!'
That\xc2\x92s right Wesley! I just stopped by to say that,\nyou\xc2\x92re not a real doctor! And that woman\xc2\x92s brain, is fine!'
(very relived) Oh! Thank God!'
Hope! Hope!'
(sleepily) Drake!'
You\xc2\x92re not dying Hope, you\xc2\x92re gonna live a long,\nhealthy life. With me.'
Oh Drake.'

Okay! (She picks up the phone, Joey\xc2\x92s phone number, and starts to\ndial.) Here we go! Okay! (On phone.) Hi, Joey! It\xc2\x92s Rachel! Umm, I am free tomorrow\nnight. Yeah, sure, sure I can bring some sandwiches.'
So honey this uh, this threesome thing umm, I mean how-how are you gonna\nstart to find\xc2\x85'
Ooh, actually I\xc2\x92ve been making a list of all the women I know who\nmight be into doing this!'

Oh. (He takes the notepad she was using and looks at it.) Wow! (Flips to\nanother page.) Huh. (Flips another page.) Boy! (Flips another page.) Well, someone\xc2\x92s\nbeen doing their homework. (Flips two more pages.)'
Yeah. Ooh, and I know Gail Rosten is in there twice, but she is so\xc2\x85'
Oh, I know. (Laughs) Y\xc2\x92know, just-just talking about it is getting me\nkinda\xc2\x85'
Oh, me too.'
Yeah? Well, I-I think Ben\xc2\x92s asleep.'
Oh umm, y\xc2\x92know I think it would be better if we just save it.'
Yeah. Right. Save it. I can do that. (Gets up and does a little kara-tay.)'
Hey, Pheebs!'
Hey.'
Hey, how\xc2\x92s it going?'
Well, I\xc2\x92ve got to get out of this bed, I\xc2\x92m going crazy here.\nCrazy!'
(handing her a cup) Here you go sweetie.'
What the hell is this, herbal tea? I hate herbal tea!'
But, I put some honey in it.'
She doesn\xc2\x92t know she was fired yet, does she?'
No, the doctors say it may kill her.'
What are you two girls whispering about over there?!'
(To Ross) But I think we should tell her.'
Hey Pheebs, maybe this whole heart attack thing is a sign, that-that you\nshould start think about getting a different job.'
Okay, what is this? A stupid contest? Because we got a winner here!\n(Points at Ross.)'
Listen Phoebe, he\xc2\x92s right. People are not supposed to have heart\nattacks at 31.'
I know! But if I didn\xc2\x92t work there, what else would I do?'
Well, you used to like playing the guitar.'
Yeah that was lucrative! Smart like your brother!'
Uh, what about y\xc2\x92know the massage thing? That never gave you a\nheart attack.'
Hmm, pulling in a salary in the high six figures or rubbing gross naked\npeople for chump change\xc2\x97ooh, what do I do?! What will I do?!'
Ohh, I mean it\xc2\x92s just so realistic!'
I know. (Joey is sitting in this tall chair that is made up of balls on\npolls. You\xc2\x92ll have to see it to know what I mean.) Yeah, his name is Pat.'
Pat the dog. Oh! Oh! I get it!! (Laughs and finishes her drink.)'
(climbing down from his chair) Do you uh, do you\xc2\x97ready for a refill?'
Oh, I probably shouldn\xc2\x92t\xc2\x97so I will! (Joey starts making her\nrefill and Rachel notices that rain thing Joey has.) Oh! Wow! It\xc2\x92s like it\xc2\x92s\nraining!'
